SEARCH
Package org.fluentjdbc

Interface DatabaseQueryBuilder<T extends DatabaseQueryBuilder<T>>

All Superinterfaces:
DatabaseQueryable<T>
All Known Subinterfaces:
DatabaseSimpleQueryBuilder<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
DatabaseJoinedQueryBuilder, DatabaseSqlBuilder, DatabaseTableQueryBuilder
public interface DatabaseQueryBuilder<T extends DatabaseQueryBuilder<T>> extends DatabaseQueryable<T>
Interface for consistent query operations in a fluent way

    singleObject(Connection connection, DatabaseResult.RowMapper<OBJECT> mapper)
    If the query returns no rows, returns SingleRow.absent(java.util.function.Supplier<EX>), if exactly one row is returned, maps it and return it, if more than one is returned, throws `IllegalStateException`
    default SingleRow<String>
    singleString(Connection connection, String fieldName)
    Returns a string from the specified column name
    T
    unordered()
    If you haven't called orderBy(java.lang.String), the results of DatabaseListableQueryBuilder.list(java.sql.Connection, org.fluentjdbc.DatabaseResult.RowMapper<OBJECT>) will be unpredictable.

    Methods inherited from interface org.fluentjdbc.DatabaseQueryable

    query, where, where, where, whereAll, whereAll, whereColumnValuesEqual, whereExpression, whereExpression, whereExpressionWithParameterList, whereIn, whereIn, whereOptional, whereOptional

  • Method Details

    • unordered

      @CheckReturnValue T unordered()
      If you haven't called orderBy(java.lang.String), the results of DatabaseListableQueryBuilder.list(java.sql.Connection, org.fluentjdbc.DatabaseResult.RowMapper<OBJECT>) will be unpredictable. Call unordered() if you are okay with this.

    • orderBy

      @CheckReturnValue T orderBy(String orderByClause)
      Adds an order by clause to the query. Needed in order to list results in a predictable order.

    • singleObject

      @Nonnull @CheckReturnValue <OBJECT> SingleRow<OBJECT> singleObject(Connection connection, DatabaseResult.RowMapper<OBJECT> mapper)
      If the query returns no rows, returns SingleRow.absent(java.util.function.Supplier<EX>), if exactly one row is returned, maps it and return it, if more than one is returned, throws `IllegalStateException`
      Parameters:
      connection - Database connection
      mapper - Function object to map a single returned row to a object
      Returns:
      the mapped row if one row is returned, SingleRow.absent(java.util.function.Supplier<EX>) otherwise
      Throws:
      MultipleRowsReturnedException - if more than one row was matched the query

    • singleString

      @Nonnull @CheckReturnValue default SingleRow<String> singleString(Connection connection, String fieldName)
      Returns a string from the specified column name
      Parameters:
      connection - Database connection
      Returns:
      the mapped row if one row is returned, SingleRow.absent(java.util.function.Supplier<EX>) otherwise
      Throws:
      MultipleRowsReturnedException - if more than one row was matched the query

    • singleInt
